Key Arguments: The Bill infringes on fundamental rights to freedom of opinion and expression as outlined in international human rights documents.
The legislation could be used to restrict public debate, censor unpopular opinions, and enforce ideological conformity.
Efforts to combat misinformation and disinformation should include transparency and scrutiny safeguards.
The Bill allows the government to define truth and control information flow, which could lead to biased interpretations.
Past government and media censorship during the Covid-19 pandemic led to negative consequences for public trust and decision-making.
Main Themes: Historical context of censorship during Covid-19
Notable Quotes: The Bill grants the government the authority to define truth, to control and manipulate the flow of information and impose restrictions on online platforms using vague, undefined terms with the risk of biased ideological interpretation.
Government and media censorship was on an industrial scale during the recent Covid-19 pandemic.
